book.title: Snap Shot
book.author: Wren Valentino
book.subtitle: A Summer of Friendship, Nostalgia, and Second Chances
book.description: When Deanna Sherman returns to Moon Lake Summer Camp, she faces more than just the ghosts of summers past. Childhood friends are waiting, old bonds spark back to life, and a first love she thought was lost resurfaces in ways she never expected. Set against the backdrop of lakeside bonfires and sun-soaked days, this heartfelt romance blends laughter, nostalgia, and second chances in a story about choosing love, friendship, and self-discovery.

audienceMatch.title: Audience Insights

bisac.additional: Romance > Friends to Lovers; Fiction > Coming-of-Age

audienceMatch.keyCharacteristics: Young, predominantly female readership who value stories of love, belonging, and nostalgia; strong engagement with digital-first formats.

analysisOverview.title: Integrated Analysis Overview
analysisOverview.readership: This book aligns closely with readers of contemporary and New Adult romance, especially those drawn to second-chance and friends-to-lovers tropes. Engagement is strongest among 18–34 year olds, with a female skew but meaningful inclusivity across genders. Discovery pathways include BookTok, Instagram, and romance-focused newsletters, while ebook and audiobook preferences ensure high accessibility and shareability. Thematically, the summer camp backdrop and ensemble friendships tap into under-served niches, expanding reach beyond core romance circles.
analysisOverview.classification: Within a bespoke taxonomy of romance subgenres, the novel positions itself at the intersection of second-chance and friends-to-lovers romance, framed through a nostalgic summer-camp setting. This hybrid classification creates distinctiveness in a crowded market while remaining familiar to fans of bestselling comparables like Emily Henry and Carley Fortune.
analysisOverview.personas: The primary persona, Samantha the YA Romance Enthusiast, highlights the book's resonance with younger readers who see their own coming-of-age transitions reflected in the narrative. Marcus, the New Adult Escapist, represents a secondary audience of slightly older readers who value stories of healing and emotional resilience, broadening the book's demographic reach.
analysisOverview.marketingGuidance: The marketing insights provide actionable direction for early campaigns, suggesting hooks around camp nostalgia, second chances, and ensemble friendship arcs. Copy can emphasize warmth, discovery, and heartfelt intimacy, while creative assets should highlight seasonal settings and emotional stakes. These foundations will later expand into a standalone marketing product, but for now serve as a strategic toolkit to drive launch momentum.

moodTags.description: Captures the warmth of summer memories, past friendships, and the bittersweet pull of returning to a familiar place.
Centers on rekindled love and slow-burn intimacy, layered with tenderness and emotional vulnerability.
Offers readers optimism, laughter, and the reassurance that love and friendship can heal old wounds.
Infused with humor, witty dialogue, and the joy of communal camp rituals and activities.
Balances lightness with moments of emotional depth, asking questions about identity, belonging, and what it means to choose love.

sam.subtitle: Readers of second-chance, friends-to-lovers, camp/summer settings
sam.description: Active buyers of contemporary romance featuring reunion, opposites-attract, grumpy/sunshine, and forced-proximity dynamics.

som.description: Achievable through BookTok creators, targeted Meta/TikTok ads, KU discovery, newsletters, and library placement.

readerPersonas.description: Personas tab - Reader persona profiles and details
readerPersonas.title: Reader Personas
readerPersonas.subtitle: Profiles of key audience segments for the Moon Lake Summer Camp romance

personas.name: Samantha, the YA Romance Enthusiast
personas.coreNeeds: Craves stories of friendship and self-discovery that mirror her own transition to adulthood.
personas.fears: Fear of rejection in love and missing out on true connection.
personas.psychologicalMotivations: Looks for reassurance that resilience and openness can lead to love and belonging.

readingBehavior.socialStyle: Engaged in online book communities and BookTok discussions.
readingBehavior.readingTimes: Late nights and weekends during school breaks.
readingBehavior.likelihoodToRecommend: Very high, especially among peer groups.
readingBehavior.tracking: Actively posts reviews on Goodreads and TikTok.

readingHabits.quote: This book made me feel like I was right back at summer camp, navigating first loves and lifelong friendships.

booksThisPersonaLoves.title: Anna and the French Kiss
booksThisPersonaLoves.author: Stephanie Perkins
booksThisPersonaLoves.description: A light-hearted coming-of-age romance about young love and identity.

films: To All the Boys I've Loved Before

moreBooks: Better Than the Movies by Lynn Painter
Since You’ve Been Gone by Morgan Matson
Field Notes on Love by Jennifer E. Smith

personas.name: Marcus, the New Adult Escapist
personas.coreNeeds: Wants reassurance that relationships can evolve and heal even after setbacks.
personas.fears: Fears being stuck in unfulfilling patterns and missing out on deep, meaningful love.
personas.psychologicalMotivations: Uses romance novels to escape work stress and to explore emotional journeys that reflect his own uncertainties.

readingBehavior.socialStyle: Occasional participant in online forums, shares casually with friends.
readingBehavior.readingTimes: During commutes and evenings after work.
readingBehavior.likelihoodToRecommend: Moderate to high, especially when a book resonates with themes of growth.
readingBehavior.tracking: Keeps a personal reading journal; uses Goodreads sparingly.

readingHabits.quote: The love triangle and camp friendships reminded me of how messy but beautiful young adulthood can be.

booksThisPersonaLoves.title: People We Meet on Vacation
booksThisPersonaLoves.author: Emily Henry
booksThisPersonaLoves.description: A witty, heartfelt romance about friendship, second chances, and travel.

moreBooks: You Deserve Each Other by Sarah Hogle
Love and Other Words by Christina Lauren

marketing.description: Marketing tab - Campaign strategy and promotional content
marketing.title: Stage 1 Comprehensive Marketing Plan
marketing.subtitle: Driving early awareness, engagement, and conversion
marketing.objective: Position the book as a relatable, heartwarming contemporary romance built on nostalgia, friendship, and second-chance love.
marketing.keyInsight: Audiences resonate with second-chance romance and summer nostalgia when paired with authentic characters and small-town charm.
howToUse: Leverage summer camp nostalgia and rural setting in campaign visuals.
Highlight the emotional stakes of rekindled love and deep friendship.
Use serialized snippets and quotes for social sharing.
Align copy tone with warmth, self-discovery, and heartfelt intimacy.

funnels.name: Awareness
funnels.description: Introduce readers to the nostalgic summer camp romance setting.
funnels.formats: Short-form video teasers, social ads, influencer posts
funnels.optimisation: Test different nostalgic hooks and tagline variations

funnels.name: Consideration
funnels.description: Deeper engagement via character spotlights, author Q&As, and free sample chapters.
funnels.formats: Instagram stories, TikTok behind-the-scenes, email mini-series
funnels.optimisation: Prioritise highest engagement segments, refine email subject lines

funnels.name: Conversion
funnels.description: Drive purchases and book club selections.
funnels.formats: Amazon/Bookshop landing pages, retargeted ads, direct call-to-actions
funnels.optimisation: A/B test purchase CTA wording and discount codes

budgetAllocation.title: Budget Allocation
budgetAllocation.breakdown: 40% digital ads (Meta, TikTok), 25% influencer and content collaborations, 20% email and community outreach, 15% traditional and print.

flightSchedule.title: Flight Schedule
flightSchedule.timeline: 6-week pre-launch awareness, 4-week launch push, 8-week sustained engagement and retargeting.

metaTargeting.title: Meta Targeting Parameters
metaTargeting.gender: Primarily female, inclusive of all genders
metaTargeting.exclusions: Hard sci-fi readers, non-English language markets at this stage

messagingFramework.title: Messaging Framework
messagingFramework.primaryTagline: A summer at Moon Lake changes everything.
supportingMessages: Second chances at love feel even sweeter under the summer sun.
Friendship, nostalgia, and romance—rediscover them all at camp.
For anyone who’s ever wondered what if.

romanceReaders.title: Romance Readers
romanceReaders.message: A heartfelt story that blends beloved tropes—friends to lovers, summer romance, and second chances.

bookClubs.title: Book Clubs
bookClubs.message: Perfect for discussion: themes of love, growth, and the choices that shape our lives.

matureReaders.title: Mature Readers
matureReaders.message: Nostalgic storytelling set in a relatable rural community, infused with heart and depth.

ruralReaders.title: Rural Readers
ruralReaders.message: Authentic small-town atmosphere with characters that reflect everyday struggles and joys.

sampleCopy.title: Sample Marketing Copy
sampleCopy.backCoverBlurb: When Deanna Sherman returns to Moon Lake Summer Camp, she's searching for more than just sunshine. She's chasing old memories, rekindling lost friendships, and confronting a love that might finally come full circle. In this heartwarming tale of self-discovery, nostalgia, and romance, summer becomes the season of second chances.

socialMediaPosts.text: What if your summer fling had a second chance? Discover Deanna's journey back to Moon Lake. #SummerRomance #BookTok
Friendship. Nostalgia. Love. This summer camp has it all. Pre-order your escape today. #RomanceReaders

emailSubjectLines: Would you give love a second chance?
Escape to Moon Lake this summer
callToActionExamples: Join the Moon Lake Readers’ Club

videoCreativeScripts.script: Opening shot of a serene lake at sunset. Cut to Deanna arriving at camp. Montage of laughter, friendship, and stolen glances. Text overlay: 'This summer, love finds its way back.'
videoCreativeScripts.soraPrompt: A cinematic summer camp setting at golden hour, friends laughing around a bonfire, soft romantic tones.

marketGaps.title: Market Opportunities
opportunities: Under-served summer-camp setting in contemporary New Adult romance
Blend of second-chance and friends-to-lovers with ensemble friendship arc
Upbeat, humorous tone suitable for PG-13 readers
Digital-age dating elements juxtaposed with offline camp immersion

uniquePositioning.title: Unique Selling Proposition
uniquePositioning.description: A feel-good New Adult summer-camp romance that fuses second-chance and friends-to-lovers dynamics with a tight ensemble cast and a witty, first-person voice.
elements: Ensemble friendship as parallel love story
Contemporary dating app context meeting offline reset

marketPositioning.pricePositioning: US ebook 5.99-6.99 USD; US trade paperback 15.99-17.99 USD
marketPositioning.seasonalStrategy: Launch late spring to early summer; align with summer-reading promotions

brandPositioning.coreMessage: Choose friendship, heal the past, and risk new love in one unforgettable summer.
keyDifferentiators: Ensemble dynamics with strong best-friend bond
brandPositioning.emotionalPromise: Readers finish smiling, seen, and hopeful about second chances.
brandPositioning.targetReaderIdentity: US readers 18-30 who enjoyed Emily Henry or Carley Fortune and want a lighter, camp-set twist
